intro: Sonerila epilobioides, commonly known as the broad-leaved sonerila, is a flowering plant native to tropical Asia. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
